Hoover Institution Archives

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Extent
physdesc.extent: 145 manuscript boxes, 4 card file boxes, 4 motion picture film reels, 4 microfilm reels

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Memoranda, reports, correspondence, registration forms, printed matter, and motion picture film, relating to conditions in Latvia under Soviet and German occupation, and to Latvian displaced persons during and after World War II. Also available on microfilm (199 reels).

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Latviesu Centrala Komiteja records, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, reports, correspondence, registration forms, printed matter, and motion picture film, relating to conditions in Latvia under Soviet and German occupation, and to Latvian displaced persons during and after World War II. Also available on microfilm (199 reels).

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the repository's online public access catalog.

did.unittitle: Materials relating to Latvian soldiers held in a prisoner of war camp at Putlos, Germany (under Allied occupation), and to events in Latvia during both Soviet and Nazi rule in Latvia, 1941-1945.
Correspondence, bulletins, and reports relating to the Information Branch, 1st division, Latvian Legion, 1945
Documents compiled in 1945 for a history of the Latvian Legion.

scopecontent.p: Includes verbatim, typewritten copies of articles from the Latvian press during the German occupation, as well as copies of orders issued by the German military administration for Ostland

did.unittitle: Documents pertaining to events in Latvia under Soviet and German occupations, including verbatim, typewritten copies of articles from the Latvian press, and also of directives issued by Soviet and German authorities
Documents concerning resistance activities in concentration camps in Latvia, 1943-1945

scopecontent.p: Includes bulletins, correspondence, news summaries, personal accounts, serial issue, music and lyrics to prisoners' songs, and some holograph illustrations of camp life

did.unittitle: Information bulletin, 1st division, Latvian Legion, and news summaries prepared for prisoners, 1945
Lectures and papers by and for prisoners, 1945
Latvian refugee camps in Germany: rosters of camp inhabitants.

scopecontent.p: Lists of names compiled by Latvian ex-POWs upon their release from Putlos camp, and on the basis of a search for relatives throughout camps in Germany

did.unittitle: Demographic information concerning the inhabitants of Latvia during the period under the first Soviet occupation, 1940-1941
Statistical data concerning those arrested and deported
Statistical data concerning those arrested and missing
Records of the Latvian gymnasia (secondary schools) at Kiel and Rendsburg
Brief history of the Kiel Gymnasium
Minutes, teachers' council meetings, Kiel Gymnasium
Minutes, school council meetings, Kiel Gymnasium, 1946
Duplicates of student certificates, Kiel Gymnasium, 1946-1948
Brief history of the Rendsburg Gymnasium.

scopecontent.p: Includes printed copy of graduation prayers

did.unittitle: Minutes, teachers' council meetings, Rendsburg Gymnasium, 1945-1947
Duplicates of student certificates, Rendsburg Gymnasium, 1947

unittitle.emph: Vestis, published by the Latvian Camp Committee at Fischbach, Germany

did.unittitle: Latvija, published at Camp Churchill, Lehrte, Germany. Nos. 281-336 (nos. 289,316,321 missing), 1947; nos. 338-346, 1948
Briva Latvija, published by Gustav Celmins, 1947-1948
Nameja Gredzens, published by Latvian POWs, Putlos, Germany, 1945.

scopecontent.p: Includes some typescript originals with holograph illustrations

did.unittitle: Dundsdorfs, Edgars, Latjijas Zeme, Iedzivotaji un Saimnieciba Prieks Leilas Emigracijas: Statistiskos Datos, Lübeck, 1945
Illustration of woman in Latvian national costume, 1945
Vilks, A., Latviesi Beglu Gaitas, Germany, 1947
The Problem of Latvian Displaced Persons, Latvian Central Committee in Western Germany, Germany, 1947 November
Shall Latvians Perish?, Latvian National Council, Esslingen, Germany, 1948 September

Demographic information concerning the inhabitants of Latvia during the period of the first Soviet occupation, 1940-1941. Official forms, with text in both German and Latvian, compiled by the Latvian Statistics Board during the German occupation of Latvia, and on the basis of a statistic sheet in use as of January 15, 1942
Statistics concerning those arrested and deported, and those registered as arrested and missing, with some other categories interspersed, all listed by family name
Statistics concerning individuals categorized as partisans, grouped largely according to district

scopecontent.p: Includes statistics from Abrenes and Talsu Districts

did.unittitle: Statistics concerning dead and wounded partisans
Statistics concerning civilian deaths due to warfare
Statistics concerning deaths attributed to the actions of Soviet forces, and other unattributed deaths
Statistics concerning wounded police force members
Statistics listing names, but without indication of category
Statistics concerning individuals listed as having fled to the Soviet Union, having pro-Soviet sympathies, or being otherwise unaccounted for, largely from the Riga District
Statistics concerning individuals listed as arrested and disappeared, and for those arrested and deported, with some other categories interspersed.

scopecontent.p: Includes data for the Riga District and other areas of Latvia

did.unittitle: Statistics concerning individuals listed as having reappeared or returned, or otherwise found to be alive.
Statistics concerning individuals listed as arrested and disappeared, and for those arrested and deported, with some other categories interspersed.
Statistics concerning individuals listed as having fled to the Soviet Union, or having pro-Soviet sympathies, or being otherwise unaccounted for
Duplicate statistic sheets, of various categories and from different regions
Statistic sheets annotated as having been "withdrawn"
Statistics concerning individuals returning to Latvia after 1941 July 1
Statistics concerning individuals returning to Latvia from the Soviet Union, and compiled principally on the basis of forms issued by the Reichskomissar for Ostland, 1942 April 11
Abrene, Daugavpils, Ilukste, and Rezekne Districts
Aizpute, Kuldiga, Liepaja, Talsu, and Ventspils Districts
Bauska, Daugavpils, Ilukste, Jekabpils, Ludza, and Rezekne Districts

Statistics concerning those individuals listed as having been deported, from the Riga District. Official forms, with text in German and English, compiled by the Latvian Statistics Board during the German occupation of Latvia, on the basis of a statistic sheet in use as of 1942 January 15
Index cards with the names of individuals listed as having returned to Latvia from the Soviet Union
Rosters of the names of Latvians in displaced person and POW camps, mainly in Germany, 1945-1946.

scopecontent.p: Includes some miscellaneous notes and correspondence

did.unittitle: Bavaria. Names listed as having been "screened"
Other locations in Germany, Austria, France, and Italy
Various other locations in Germany and Austria
Photograph albums of scenes depicting Latvian displaced persons in Germany, 1947-1948
Holy Communion, Anna Church, Augsburg, Germany, 1947
Ligo festival and other scenes, Camp Hochfeld, 1947
Materials relating to Latvian displaced person camps at Seedorf and Rotenburg, Germany, 1946-1949
Roster of the names of discharged Latvian POWs, 1946
Official notices, bulletins, and memoranda from British authorities, 1947-1949.

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence to and from camp leaders

did.unittitle: Copies of training school certificates and other documents issued to camp residents, 1948
Correspondence between camp leaders and British authorities, 1947-1948
Correspondence between camp leaders and refugee organizations, 1947-1948
Minutes of meetings and other documents relating to the election of camp leaders and committee members, 1947-1948
Copies of training certificates and other documents, 1947-1949
Food supply records, including receipts and ration schedules, 1948-1949
Miscellaneous materials relating to Latvians in the Leipzig area, 1945
Miscellaneous materials relating to Latvians in the Leipzig area, 1945
Materials relating to the Latvian displaced person camp at Hohnsen, Germany, 1945-1947
Materials relating to Latvian displaced person camps and colonies in the Braunschweig region, Germany, 1945-1948
Minutes of the Braunschweig district committee, 1946-1947
General file, Goslar and Bad Wurzburg colonies, 1946
Minutes of the Liebenburg camp committee, 1946-1948
Accounts of the Liebenburg camp committee, 1945-1948
Instructions and circulars of the Liebenburg camp committee, 1947
Miscellaneous materials relating to Latvian displaced person camps in Germany, 1945-1948
Minutes of the camp committee and general meetings, Gauja camp, Melle, 1946-1947
General file, Sarstedt dairy and horticultural school, 1946-1947
General file, Schutzenberg camp at Detmold, 1945-1946
Register of the names of individuals in transit through Schutzenberg camp, 1945
Materials relating to community courts having jurisdiction over Latvians in Germany, 1946-1947
Register and alphabetical file of criminal cases
Register and alphabetical file of civil cases
Publications of the Latvian State Bureau of Statistics, 1924-1940
Vispariga sejumu un majlopu saitisana Latvija 1935. gada, 1938
Latvijas lauksaimnieciba pec 1923. gada lauksaimniecibas skaitisanas zinam, 1924
Vispariga sejumu un majlopu skaitisana Latvija 1937. gada, 1938
Issuances of the Latvian government and military, 1919-1940
Orders of the Minister of Defense, 1919
Orders of the Minister of War

scopecontent.p: Includes materials relating to the liquidation of the Latvian army following the Soviet annexation of Latvia

did.unittitle: Orders of the Commander-in-Chief and Chief Inspector of the Latvian army
Lists of promotions in the Latvian army, 1938-1940
Orders, reports, and other records relating to Latvian police and military units, 1941-1945
Liaison Officer, Police and SS Headquarters, Liepaja, 1942
Records of the Latviesu Centrala Komiteja in Germany, 1945-1947
Records of the Latvian National Committee, Potsdam, Germany, 1944-1945
Memoranda and resolutions concerning the status of the Baltic states, 1945-1946
Correspondence between Janis Meizis and Karlis Zarins, 1945-1948.
Records of the 1st Latvian District Committee, Lubeck, Germany, 1945-1947
Correspondence, minutes of meetings, and materials relating to the election of committee members, 1945-1947
Directives and other materials concerning the status of displaced persons, 1945-1947
Publications of the Latvian State Bureau of Statistics, 1931-1940
Photographs depicting life in Latvian displaced person camps in Germany, 1945-1947
Casualty reports and other records relating to Latvian policemen and soldiers in World War II, 1942-1944
Correspondence, cemetery plans, and names of the dead, largely in relation to fighting on the Eastern Front, 1942-1944
Death records, including accompanying correspondence, concerning Latvian policemen and soldiers, 1942-1944
Death records, including accompanying correspondence, concerning Latvian policemen and soldiers, 1942-1944
Lists of missing and fallen soldiers, 1942-1944

Lists of those killed in action, 1942-1944
Lists of those killed in action, 1942-1944
Orders, reports, and other records relating to Latvian police and military units, 1942-1944
Liaison Officer to Chief of Police and SS, 1943
Names of soldiers killed in action, various units, 1942-1944
Records of the delegation of the Latviesu Centrala Komiteja in the American zone of occupation in Germany, 1946-1947
Records of the Latvian Central Council in Germany, 1945-1948.
Records of the Latvian National Committee and other organizations in Germany, 1944-1946
Financial records of 1st Latvian District Committee, 1946
Instructions, notices, and orders of the president of the Latvian National Committee, 1945
Decrees of the president of the Latvian National Committee, 1945

scopecontent.p: Includes information on wages and salaries

did.unittitle: Reports on conditions in displaced person camps, 1945
Correspondence concerning the Latvian War Hospital in Schwerin, 1945
File on Latvian prisoners of war, 1944-1945
File on closing of Latvian police headquarters, 1945
Materials relating to Latvian prisoners of war in Putlos, 1944-1945
Instructions and orders issued by 626 Military Government Detachment, 1946
Correspondence with the United Nations Relief and Rehabilitation Administration (UNRRA), 1946
Financial records of the 1st Latvian District Committee, 1946
General file of the Latvian Agricultural Training School in Alt-Erfrade, 1946-1947
Records of the Latvian Representation at Detmold, Germany, 1945-1948
Records pertaining to Latvian police forces, 1944-1945
General file of the headquarters for the liquidation of police operations, 1944-1945
Correspondence file of the headquarters for the liquidation of police operations, 1944-1945
Correspondence concerning the tracing of relatives, 1944-1945
Materials relating to the evacuation of a hospital in Riga, 1944-1945
Materials relating to the arrival of employees in Germany, 1944-1945
Materials relating to the issuance of food coupons, 1944
